text.section: A person is guilty of possession of an eavesdropping device when he possesses any electronic, mechanical or other device designed or commonly used for eavesdropping with intent to use that device to eavesdrop or knowing that another intends to use that device to eavesdrop.
Possession of an eavesdropping device is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 229, effective January 1, 1975.
